content: metal mel-roformer fine-tune instrumental model
focused more on bleedless
training is still in progress, that's why it's a beta test of the model
it should work fine for a lot of things, but it has quirks on some tracks
to me there's some vocal stuff still audible on some tracks
i'm mostly trying to get feedback on how i could improve it
description.author: mesk

content: can be also used for crowd removal
description.author: gabox

content: can even separate violin quartets from cellos
description.author: smilewasfound

content: does seem to pick up more than just violins imo
for separating high strings in particular it is really cool
description.author: musicalman

content: one of my favorite fullness inst models atm.
sounds like v1e to me but cleaner.
especially with guitar/piano where v1e tended to add more phase distortion, i guess that's what you'd call it lol.
this model preserves their purity better imo
description.author: musicalman

content: the way it sounds, is indeed the best fullness model, it's like between v1e and v1e+
not so noisy and full enough
creates problems with instruments gone in the instrumental sadly
fixes crossbleeding of vocals in instrumental in a lot of songs, compared to previous models
no robotic voice bug at silent instrumental moments
description.author: dca100fb8

content: some songs leaves vocal residue. it is heard little but felt
description.author: fabio

content: almost loses some sounds that v1e+ picks up just fine
description.author: neoculture

content: mushes some synths a bit in e.g. trap/drill tune compared to inst mel-roformers like instv7/becruily/fvx/inst3
the residues/vocal shells are a bit quieter, although the clarity is also decreased a bit.
less crossbleeding than paid dango 11.
sounds like b5e with vocal enhancer.
needs more training, some instruments are confused as vocals
description.author: gabox

content: fv6 = fv4 but with better background vocal capture
description.author: neoculture

content: you'll most likely get better results with gabox denoise/debleed mel-roformer model instead
description.author: gabox

content: just use it on the mixture
description.author: gabox

content: sounds great
description.author: rage313

content: sometimes removes back vocals especially if they're panned to the sides.
also a vocal/inst seperator. dry vocals go in vocal stem, everything else goes to reverb.
description.author: musicalman

content: omg, this model is doing a really good job at capturing backing vocals
honestly, it sounds a bit muddy, and there's some instrumental bleeding into the vocal stems
description.author: neoculture

content: not so good for speech denoising unlike some other models
description.author: musicalman

content: noisy with small vocal residuals in places where music is low and deletions of some musical instruments.
noisy with small vocal residuals in places where music is low and deletions of some musical instruments.
sound is good, but sometimes some instruments are lowered or deleted
while the annoying buzzing/noise is still present, it seems to be more contained.
less full than v7, but have less vocal residues.
results from v8 and v10 are the same
both remove some instruments from the music, like v7.
as for noise, however, they are less noisy
noisier but fuller
focusing on the less amount of noise keeping fullness
the results were similar to instv7 but with less noise
description.author: neoculture

content: very clean
muddier than v1e+.
a vocal model specialized in fullness.
revive 3e is the opposite of version 2 --- it pushes fullness to the extreme.
description.author: unwa

content: not sota, but much more efficient and comparable to existing guitar models
for some songs it might work better because it picks up more guitars (though it can also pick some other instruments).
for better results you might try first removing vocals.
has a bleedless score that surpasses the ft2 bleedless
can keep the string well
description.author: daylight

content: it does capture more than viperx's
description.author: mesk

content: less instrument bleed in vocal track compared to bs 1296/1297
works great as a phase fixer reference to remove mel roformer inst models noise
description.author: dca100fb8

content: might have some "ugly vocal residues" at times
description.author: dca

content: vs v1e "it seems to pick up some instruments better"
description.author: gabox

content: a bit cleaner-sounding and has less filtering/watery artifacts.
both models are prone to very strange vocal leakage
because fv8 can be so clean at times, the leakage can be fairly obvious.
description.author: musicalman

content: fv5 sounds a bit fuller than fv4, but the vocal chops end up in the vocal stem.
in my opinion, fv4 is better for removing vocal chops from the vocal stem
description.author: neoculture

content: v5 is slightly fuller, v4 is less full but also slightly more careful about what it considers as vocals.
i think b5e is the fullest overall, but it's a bit much sometimes.
pretty sure the gabox models are a little more accurate with vocal/instrument detection.
description.author: musicalman

content: less noise than v1e (esp. in the lower frequencies), but it's also less full - "somewhere between v1 and v1e."
has fewer problems with quiet vocals in instrumentals than the v1+
issues with harmonica, saxophone, elec guitar and synth seem to have been fixed.
the loss function was changed to be more fullness-oriented, and trained a further 50k steps from the v1+ test.
description.author: unwa

content: v1e keeps better instruments like trumps than v1e+
description.author: koseidon72

content: v1e+ has a strange problem of almost vocoding the vocals and keeping them in quietly
has some problems with cymbals bleed in vocals
description.author: dca

content: it is based on v1e, but the fullness is not as high as v1e, so it is positioned as an improved version of v1.
description.author: unwa

content: very nice model, the multistft noise is gone
seems to have significantly less sax and harmonica bleed in vocal
it still struggles with other things like fx and kazoo.
description.author: dca

content: it sounds clean. the only thing [is] that some instruments are deleted, and in some tracks leaves remnants of voice in the instrumental.
description.author: fabio

content: should work fine for all genres of metal, but doesn't work on:
- hard compressed screams
- some background vocals
- weird tracks (think meshuggah's "the ayahuasca experience")
it is probably the highest sdr or log wmse score in my model to date.
dim 512, depth 12.
it is the largest mel-band roformer model i have ever uploaded.
noticed too many vocal residues.
there is no noise
primarily aimed at reducing leakage of wind instruments to vocals.
can be muddy sometimes
i hear less noise compared to v1e, but it has worse bleedless metric
the lead vocals are good and clean!
while the backing tracks are lossy for this model, [it still] provide[s] great convenient for those who need ldv
the model doesn't keep the backing vocals below the main vocals, sometimes the backing vocals will be lost
while it emphasizes fullness, the noise is well-balanced and does not interfere much
in sections without vocals, faint, rustling vocals can be heard
very clean, non-muddy vocals. loving this model so far
description.author: mrmason347

content: although it belongs to the big series, the characteristics of the model are similar to those of the ft series
this model is based on ft2 bleedless with the dim increased to 512
it does not have the output noise problem of 5e, but instead sacrifices fullness
simply put, it is a more conservative model
description.author: unwa

content: more fullness than v1e
some people find it having less noise vs v1e, and more fullness
more fullness vs instv6, and more noise
for noise from fullness models (tested on v5n) - it can't remove vocal residues
is slightly better than v5
v1e still gives better fullness, but noise [in v1e] is a problem
supports mono, but ability to remove bleed and bv is decreased
should not matter whether it's singing or speech, because my dataset contains speech
it seems that most vocal leakage is gone, and the noise did significantly decrease, although there's still a bit more noise presence than v1e.
in terms of fullness though, for some reason it sounds as if it's actually less full than v1e, despite the higher instrumental fullness sdr.
description.author: shintaro

content: doesn't struggle so much with choirs like most mel-roformers, although may not help in all cases
like v1e when it comes to fullness
it might pick up entire sax in vocal stem.
it's like demucs v4 but worse i think
the vocals have a ton of bleed, the bass is disappointing tbh
the other stem has a ton of bgv and adlib bleed in it
description.author: isling

content: it's like the v1 model with phase fixer, but it gets more instruments,
like, it prevents some instruments getting into the vocals
sometimes both models don't get choirs
this model only works with vocals. you need to pre-isolate the vocals.
it tends to muddy instrumental outputs at times, similarly like the og kim's model was doing, which didn't happen in the previous ft model by unwa.
it's using a new value residual learning added to roformer arch by lucidrains in the og roformer.
i think it sounds better than large rn but still not good, needs some [more] epoch[s]!
trained two new models specifically targeting large reverb removal.
after training, i combined these two models with my v2 model through a blending process, to better handle all scenarios.
more effective in removing large reverb.
description.author: sucial

content: instrumental model is as clean as unwa's v1, but has less noise
doesn't require phase fix from mel-kim like unwa models
it handles the busy instrumentals in a way that makes vr finally an arch of the past
correctly removes sfx voice.
more instruments correctly recognized as instruments and not vocals
vocal model pulling almost studio quality metal screams effortlessly. wow, i've never heard that scream so cleanly
description.author: mesk

content: it enhances both our new bleedless (36.95 vs 36.75) and fullness (16.40 vs 16.26) metric for vocals vs the original mel kim model.
if they sing at intervals (one by one), they cannot be separated.
works pretty good, bleed might occur occasionally.
it seems to pick up various people dialogues.
it seems to fix some issues with trumpets in vocal stem
description.author: maxi74x1

content: it handles reverb tails much better
description.author: jarredou/Rage123

content: it's noisy and, idk, grainy? when the accompaniment gets too loud.
definitely not muddy though, which is a welcome change imho.
i think i prefer beta 4 overall
description.author: musicalman

content: the noise is terrible when that model is used for very intense songs
description.author: unwa

content: feel so full af, but it has noticeable noise similar to lew's vocal enhancer
the "e" stands for emphasis, indicating that this is a model that emphasizes fullness.
however, compared to v1, while the fullness score has increased, there is a possibility that noise has also increased.
lighter compared to v2.
sounds very similar to v1 but has less noise, pretty good
the aforementioned noise from the v1 is less noticeable to none at all, depending on the track.
v2 is more muddy than v1 (on some songs), but less muddy than the kim model.
[as for v1,] sometimes it's better at high frequencies
description.author: aufr33

content: slightly a bit better sdr and fewer residues
focused on both instrumental and vocal stem.
vocals sound similar to beta 4 model, instrumentals are deprived of the noise present in inst v1 model, but as a downside, they don't sound similarly muddy to previous roformers.
much less muddy (..) but carries the exact same uvr noise from the [mdx-net v2] models
it's a different type of noise, so aufr33 denoiser won't work on it.
metrics on my test dataset have improved over beta3, but are probably not accurate due to the small test dataset.
the high frequencies of vocals are now extracted more aggressively. however, leakage may have increased.
description.author: unwa

content: one of the best at isolating most vocals with very little vocal bleed and still doesn't sound muddy
gives fuller vocals
free from the high frequency ringing present in the previous beta models
definitely better than kim's now
worse sdr than other fine-tuned models on mvsep by zfturbo, but better sdr than kim's melroformer and viperx base model
more muddy than kim's roformer, a bit less of vocal residues, a bit more artificial sound
not totally bad results as for 7.68 sdr, but it was trained on subpar gpu for roformers for only 5 days
the roformer model does a better job at retaining the instruments and vocals as well as some sound effects and synths better than the mdx-net decrowd, but at the cost of crowd bleed.
sometimes [the old model] mistakes the fuzzy sounds of guitar as crowd noise
also isolates some kicks in songs
description.author: kashi

content: anvuew's models can remove reverb effect only from vocals.
old foxjoy's model works with full track.
base model with SDR of 12.9755, widely used for fine-tuning.
